message.content: {"id": "45145", "title": "Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using the first", "description": "", "OB": "When switching from another application to one of the Eclipse windows, clicking on a docked view or perspective should not cause the other window to come to the front and overlay windows of other applications.", "EB": "Currently, when I switch from another application to one of the Eclipse windows and click on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window comes to the front and overlays windows of other applications.", "SR": "To resolve this issue, the behavior should be modified so that clicking on a docked view or perspective in one Eclipse window does not bring the other window to the front, thereby preventing it from obscuring windows of other applications."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '45145', 'title': 'Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Unless I click on the Eclipse dock icon, the only time a window should cometo the front is if I click on it explicitly (or some behavior takes me to a widget in the other window). ', 'SR': "I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows. "}
